00011 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00012 --                                                                           --
00013 --                                   nanofip                                 --
00014 --                                                                           --
00015 --                               CERN, BE/CO/HT                              --
00016 --                                                                           --
00017 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00018 --
00019 -- unit name: nanofip (nanofip / nanofip)
00020 --
00021 --! @brief Top level design file of nanofip.
00022 --!
00023 --! The NanoFIP is an FPGA component implementing the WorldFIP protocol that
00024 --! can be used in field devices able to communicate at the three standard 
00025 --! speeds. The NanoFIP, that is developed as part of the WorldFIP insourcing
00026 --! project, is designed to be radiation tolerant by using different single 
00027 --! event upset mitigation techniques such as triple module redundancy. 
00028 --! The device is used in conjunction with a FielDrive driver chip and FieldTR
00029 --! insulating transformer, both available from the company ALSTOM. 
00030 --!
00031 --! Design based on NanoFIP functional specification v1.2 
00032 --! http://www.ohwr.org/twiki/pub/OHR/CernFIP/WP3/cernfip_fspec1_2.pdf
00033 --!
00034 --! More information at http://www.ohwr.org/twiki/bin/view/OHR/CernFIP/ \n
00035 --! 
00036 --
00037 --! @author Erik van der Bij (Erik.van.der.Bij@cern.ch)
00038 --
00039 --! @date 30/06/2009
00040 --
00041 --! @version v0.1
00042 --
00043 --! @details 
00044 --!
00045 --! <b>Dependencies:</b>\n
00046 --! 
00047 --!
00048 --! <b>References:</b>\n
00049 --! 
00050 --! 
00051 --!
00052 --! <b>Modified by:</b>\n
00053 --! Author: Erik van der Bij
00054 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00055 --! \n\n<b>Last changes:</b>\n
00056 --! 30/06/2009  v0.01  EB  First version \n
00057 --!
00058 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00059 --! @todo Create entity \n

00065 --============================================================================
00066 --! Entity declaration for long entity name of my_entity
00067 --============================================================================
00068 entity nanofip is
00069 
00070 port (
00071 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00072 -- WorldFIP settings
00073 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00074       --! Bit rate         \n
00075       --! 00: 31.25 kbit/s \n
00076       --! 01: 1 Mbit/s     \n
00077       --! 10: 2.5 Mbit/s   \n
00078       --! 11: reserved, do not use
00079    rate_i    : in  std_logic_vector (1 downto 0); --! Bit rate
00080 
00081       --! Subscriber number coding. Station address.
00082    subs_i    : in  std_logic_vector (7 downto 0); --! Subscriber number coding.
00083 
00084       --! Identification selection (see M_ID, C_ID)
00085    s_id_o    : out std_logic_vector (1 downto 0); --! Identification selection
00086 
00087       --! Identification variable settings. 
00088       --! Connect the ID inputs either to Gnd, Vcc, S_ID[0] or S_ID[1] to 
00089       --! obtain different values for the Model data (i=0,1,2,3).\n
00090       --! M_ID[i] connected to: Gnd S_ID0 SID1 Vcc               \n
00091       --! Model [2*i]            0    1    0    1                \n
00092       --! Model [2*i+1]          0    0    1    1
00093    m_id_i    : in  std_logic_vector (3 downto 0); --! Model identification settings
00094 
00095       --! Constructor identification settings.
00096       --! Connect the ID inputs either to Gnd, Vcc, S_ID[0] or S_ID[1] to 
00097       --! obtain different values for the Model data (i=0,1,2,3).\n
00098       --! C_ID[i] connected to: Gnd S_ID0 SID1 Vcc               \n
00099       --! Constructor[2*i]       0    1    0    1                \n
00100       --! Constructor[2*i+1]     0    0    1    1
00101    c_id_i    : in  std_logic_vector (3 downto 0); --! Constructor identification settings
00102 
00103       --! Produced variable data length \n
00104       --! 000: 2 Bytes                  \n
00105       --! 001: 8 Bytes                  \n
00106       --! 010: 16 Bytes                 \n
00107       --! 011: 32 Bytes                 \n
00108       --! 100: 64 Bytes                 \n
00109       --! 101: 124 Bytes                \n
00110       --! 110: reserved, do not use     \n
00111       --! 111: reserved, do not use     \n
00112       --! Actual size: +1 NanoFIP Status byte +1 MPS Status byte (last transmitted) 
00113    p3_lgth_i : in  std_logic_vector (2 downto 0); --! Produced variable data length
00114 
00115 
00116 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00117 --  FIELDRIVE connections
00118 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00119    fd_rstn_o : out std_logic; --! Initialisation control, active low
00120    fd_wdgn_i : in  std_logic; --! Watchdog on transmitter
00121    fd_txer_i : in  std_logic; --! Transmitter error
00122    fd_txena_o: out std_logic; --! Transmitter enable
00123    fd_txck_o : out std_logic; --! Line driver half bit clock
00124    fx_txd_o  : out std_logic; --! Transmitter data
00125    fx_rxa_i  : in  std_logic; --! Reception activity detection
00126    fx_rxd_i  : in  std_logic; --! Receiver data
00127 
00128 
00129 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00130 --  USER INTERFACE, General signals
00131 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00132    uclk_i    : in  std_logic; --! 40 MHz clock
00133 
00134       --! Stand-alone mode
00135       --! If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with 
00136       --! the produced data.
00137    slone_i   : in  std_logic; --! Stand-alone mode
00138 
00139       --! No NanoFIP status transmission
00140       --! If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with 
00141       --! the produced data.
00142    nostat_i  : in  std_logic; --! No NanoFIP status transmission
00143 
00144    rstin_i   : in  std_logic; --! Initialisation control, active low
00145 
00146       --! Reset output, active low. Active when the reset variable is received 
00147       --! and the second byte contains the station address.
00148    rston_o   : out std_logic; --! Reset output, active low
00149 
00150 
00151 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00152 --  USER INTERFACE, non WISHBONE
00153 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00154 
00155       --! Signals new data is received and can safely be read (Consumed 
00156       --! variable 05xyh). In stand-alone mode one may sample the data on the 
00157       --! first clock edge VAR1_RDY is high.
00158    var1_rdy_o: out std_logic; --! Variable 1 ready
00159 
00160       --! Signals that the user logic is accessing variable 1. Only used to 
00161       --! generate a status that verifies that VAR1_RDY was high when 
00162       --! accessing. May be grounded.
00163    var1_acc_i: in  std_logic; --! Variable 1 access
00164 
00165       --! Signals new data is received and can safely be read (Consumed 
00166       --! broadcast variable 04xyh). In stand-alone mode one may sample the 
00167       --! data on the first clock edge VAR1_RDY is high.
00168    var2_rdy_o: out std_logic; --! Variable 2 ready
00169 
00170       --! Signals that the user logic is accessing variable 2. Only used to 
00171       --! generate a status that verifies that VAR2_RDY was high when 
00172       --! accessing. May be grounded.
00173    var2_acc_i: in  std_logic; --! Variable 2 access
00174 
00175       --! Signals that the variable can safely be written (Produced variable 
00176       --! 06xyh). In stand-alone mode, data is sampled on the first clock after
00177       --! VAR_RDY is deasserted.
00178    var3_rdy_o: out std_logic; --! Variable 3 ready
00179 
00180       --! Signals that the user logic is accessing variable 3. Only used to 
00181       --! generate a status that verifies that VAR3_RDY was high when 
00182       --! accessing. May be grounded.
00183    var3_acc_i: in  std_logic; --! Variable 3 access
00184 
00185 
00186 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00187 --  USER INTERFACE, WISHBONE SLAVE
00188 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00189    wclk_i    : in  std_logic; --! Wishbone clock. May be independent of UCLK.
00190 
00191       --! Data in. Wishbone access only on bits 7-0. Bits 15-8 only used
00192       --! in stand-alone mode.
00193    dat_i     : in  std_logic_vector (15 downto 0); --! Data in
00194 
00195       --! Data out. Wishbone access only on bits 7-0. Bits 15-8 only used
00196       --! in stand-alone mode.
00197    dat_o     : out std_logic_vector (15 downto 0); --! Data out
00198    adr_i     : in  std_logic_vector ( 9 downto 0); --! Address
00199    rst_i     : in  std_logic; --! Wishbone reset. Does not reset other internal logic.
00200    stb_i     : in  std_logic; --! Strobe
00201    ack_o     : out std_logic; --! Acknowledge
00202    we_i      : in  std_logic --! Write enable
00203 
00204 );
00205 
00206 end entity nanofip;
00207 
00208 
00209 --! Architecture contains only connectivity
00210 architecture struc of nanofip is
00211 begin
00212 end a1;
